intro: Gunnarella neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia gunnaria, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is often found in humid, coastal environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
